intro: Odontandra tuberculata, commonly known as the rough-stemmed odontandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
